page.title: 01TRANSPORT (Railway - 1 of 3)
page.content: {North Weald Station,}on the Central Line of London Transport, has the distinction of being the highest on the network, and having the only public level-crossing, albeit a farm accommodation crossing now used only by pedestrians. The station building is a typical example of Great Eastern architecture, but train services are now only provided during Monday to Friday peak hours, the whole question of the rail service to North Weald and Ongar having been the subject of much public controversy in recent times. The former London Transport Executive abandoned over a decade ago the premise that suburban commuter railways are costed as a whole, with the overcrowded inner parts balancing the lightly used outer ends. {(continued)}
